poem:
Title: Dual Reveries of a Political Dawn

Sunak spins a scare, a spectral dance,
Starmer's quiet respite speaks a chance.
Darkened corners Tory tricks do shine,
Resistance found in Labour's crimson line.
Who, in fear's thrall, can truly govern free?
The call echoes, o'er a quiet sea. 
Beneath the party rosettes, hearts reside,
Trust in them, let hope be our guide.
